intro: Argostemma carstensense, commonly known as the Carstens' argostemma, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and prominent stamens. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests.
